lines.text:
[to le Chandre, referring to his mistress, Madame Pompadour]
Should I chance to find her, I'm afraid I shall have your head...
[to Beaucaire]
... and yours too!
Naturally! Two heads are better than one!

[Referring to the guillotine]
What a way to die!
Be brave my friend. You wanted to go anyway.
But like a man, not like a salami!
Go on! Help him!
Who me?
Yes, you! You're a man. You've got blood in your veins.
I wanna keep it there. It's the squirty kind.
Oh, you're so right. One look is enough.
That regal forehead runs in the family.
The Hapsburg chin!
Got that from my mother.
The Bourbon nose!
Got that from my father, drank like a fish!
Those dark, flashing eyes - that soft lustrous hair!
You should see it after a rinse!
If you leave, you'll be cut in bits!
If I stay, bigger chunks!
...you know how I am about weddings.
Do you remember? Louis? Our wedding?
Hanh?
Ours.

[Recalling the past fondly]
Of course, I do. Forty years ago. Ah, My Dear, you were the most beautiful, the most radiant woman in all France.
Oh, Louis!
Yes, My Dear, you were. When I look at you today...
[Changing mood]
Forty years is a long time!
